Sequence Information.Peptide Name: YRA 15–13 (YRA15–13; Synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich, XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 50% similar toCATH-2(1-15) analogR: 40%, L: 20%, I=A: 13%.Activity: Active against Gram- P. aeruginosa ATCC 25,668 (MIC 5 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27,853 (MIC 2.5 uM), A. baumannii ATCC 1605 (MIC 40 uM), K.pneumoniae ATCC 27,736 (MIC 160 uM),  Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 29,213 (MIC 80 uM).MOA: leakage in liposomes, likely membrane targeting.Structure:  partially helical is less clear in anionic liposomes than YRA 15-23.In vitro toxicity: human RBC: not hemol.lytic at 100 uM.Peptide stability: Unlike LL-37, it is resistant to V8 protease and elastase but can be degraded by proteinase K.Animal model:mouse: substantially reduced P. aeruginosa burden in the mouse burn wound after 24 or 48 h comparable to colistin.Deposited and provided by Manjul Lata Jan2025.
Literature Information.Author: Lata M, Telang V, Gupta P, Pant G, Kalyan M, Arockiaraj J, Pasupuleti M.2023
Literature Information.Reference: Curr Res Microb Sci. 2023 Mar 17;4:100183. doi: 10.1016/j.crmicr.2023.100183.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Evolutionary and in silico guided development of novel peptide analogues for antibacterial activity against ESKAPE pathogens
